meanings.definition: To be under obligation to pay or repay (money or something else) to someone in return for something received.
meanings.sent1: I owe my friend five dollars for the movie ticket.
meanings.sent2: She owes the library a book that is overdue.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks I owe her treats for being a good pet.
meanings.sent4: The student owes his success to hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: I owe my parents a debt of gratitude for all their support.

meanings.definition: To be in debt to someone for (something).
meanings.sent1: He owes his neighbor a favor for helping with the yard work.
meanings.sent2: They owe the bank money for the loan they took out.
meanings.sent3: I owe my dog a walk for being cooped up all day.
meanings.sent4: The company owes its success to loyal customers.
meanings.sent5: She owes her success to the mentorship she received.

meanings.definition: To be morally or legally bound to do something.
meanings.sent1: We owe it to ourselves to always strive for improvement.
meanings.sent2: The politician owes the public honesty and transparency.
meanings.sent3: I owe it to my plants to water them regularly.
meanings.sent4: The team owes it to their fans to give their best performance.
meanings.sent5: She owes it to her community to give back.
